meanings.definition: To shut with force and noise
meanings.sent1: She slams the door when she's angry.
meanings.sent2: He always slams the window shut before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The wind slams the door closed, startling the cat.
meanings.sent4: The final scene of the play slams the door on any hope for reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm slams the shutters against the house, creating a loud noise.

meanings.sent1: The slam of the car crash echoed through the street.
meanings.sent2: The basketball made a loud slam as it hit the backboard.
meanings.sent3: The slam of the books falling off the shelf made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The slam of the waves against the shore was calming to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The slam of the hammer against the nail signaled the completion of the project.

meanings.definition: A harsh or critical comment or review
meanings.sent1: Her review was a harsh slam on the new restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The article received a lot of attention due to its critical slam on the movie.
meanings.sent3: The slam of the critic's words left the actor feeling dejected.
meanings.sent4: The slam of the judge's ruling was unexpected by many.
meanings.sent5: The slam of the editor's feedback motivated the writer to improve.

meanings.definition: To criticize severely or attack verbally
meanings.sent1: He slams his opponents during debates.
meanings.sent2: She always slams her coworkers behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully slam each other's fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: The politician slams his rival's policies in every speech.
meanings.sent5: The coach slams the team for their lack of effort during practice.
